result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence H Schuman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence H Schuman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence H Schuman was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lawrence H Schuman was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No contact with Ronney Smith. No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - Court has no objections to the defendant serving this sentence in any other county in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lawrence H Schuman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Lawrence H Schuman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:38 PM. State - here for sentencing after revocation - have received revocation paperwork - just reading it now - needs a few minutes to review it. Joy has revocation paperwork - no errors or inaccuracies. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 8 months on each count (1 and 2)- consecutive to each other - credit for 146 days on count #1. Joy makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 12 months of incarceration total with good time and 146 days credit. Joy informs Court that the defendant's grandmother is in the Courtroom to make a statement. State - have complied with victim notification requirements - want to make an additional statement prior to any other statements. Court allows. State makes additional comments. Donna Larson (grandmother of defendant) makes a statement prior to Court's sentencing. Schuman withholds comment. Joy makes additional comment in regards to State's last comments. Court sentences the defendant to the folllowing: counts #1 - 9 months in FC jail, #2 - 7 months in FC jail - consecutive to each other - huber and good time allowed - credit for 146 days - Court has no objections to the defendant serving the sentence in any other County in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s) - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), right to appeal, adjourned.
Adjustment Number: 17A 001420, Payable Number: 38077, Receipt Number: 17R 002733, Amount: $20.00

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lawrence H Schuman in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement, Count 1 - amend to delete repeater, Count 2 would be amended to 946.41 - Obstructing an Officer, Count 3 would be dismissed. With held sentence, 18 months probation, costs on each count, restitution $1074.98 plus victim witness charge totals $1182.47 to Ronny Smith, joint and several with Richard Allen. Conditions of probation: no consumption/possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns. Court amends Count 1 to delete repeater allegation, Schuman pleads NC to the amended count. Court amends Count 2 to obstructing an officer 946.41 and advises of new penalties, Schuman enters NC plea to the amended count. Court dismisses count 3. Court has PLQ and goes over it with Schuman, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to jury trial. Court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State has complied with victim/witness and asks the court to follow joint recommendation. Dickens asks that bond be refunded to poster for stated reasons on the record and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Schuman with holds comment. Court will follow joint recomendation and sentences to the following: Counts 1 & 2 - With hold sentence place on probation for 18 months on each count, costs on each count, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, FT emp/schooling, no contat with Ronney Smith, restitution $1182.47 (includes surcharge) joint and several, court will not refund bond to poster, money posted will be used for restitution, DNA sample (expunction rights given), right to appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney William Allen Dickens in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:26 PM. Court continues bond, set for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Arrested FOSO - James Polar - further Judge S cancelled the material witness warrant as the PH hearing was held on 3/24/16 and the witness was no longer needed.
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lawrence H Schuman, in custody, in court with attorney William Allen Dickens. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:29 PM. State - continuation for PH. State has provided all witnesses, one of the defense witnesses had not shown up previously and a warrant was issued for the witness, he has not yet been detained. Dickens - wanted to call witness R.A., but was advised at last hearing that R.A.'s attorney should be here for any testimony. Court would like to reschedule to get both witness to be able to testify, wait for JP to be arrested. Schuman indicates to his attorney that he would like to get this case moving. Dickens would like to proceed with PH with all evidence that has been provided, per request of his client. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State has filed INFO which mirrors. Dickens would like to proceed to ARGN, waives further reading of INFO and enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond is a mute point as of today due to revocation.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Body Only - To be held until appears in front of Judge Stenz.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lawrence H Schuman, in custody, in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:05 PM. State - calls witness, Ronney Smith, 2:06 PM. State directs. Record reflects defendant has been identified, 2:16 PM. Cross exam by Attorney Dickens, 2:16 PM. State objects - over ruled, 2:16 PM. State objects - sustained, 2:18 PM. State re-directs, 2:22 PM. Dickens re-cross, 2:22 PM. State objects, relevance - sustained, 2:23 PM. Dickens would like to call Richard Allen as a witness and would like to reconvine as he would like to call James Polar, but has not appeared today and would like him to be apprehended. Court will issue a material witness warrant for James Polar. State - does not object and has officers aware James Polar was subpoenaed for court today. Court will adjourn to allow James Polar to appear and also would like Attorney Scholke to appear with witness, Richard Allen. Bond will be continued. Material Witness Warrant for James Polar is to be held in custody until appears before the judge. Adjourned, 2:29 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Ronny Smith and no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Lawrence H Schuman in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Lawrence H Schuman in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:06 AM. Dickens has complaint and has gone over it with the defendant, appearing specially today, waives reading of complaint, set for PH. Court sets for PH. Dickens - defendant is on P&P hold. State - bond - $2500.00 cash bond, no contact with Ronny Smith and no consumption of alcohol. Dickens waives time limits for PH.  Court considers time limits waived. Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
